description: A streamInDropFault notification signifies that the SNMP
entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the
streamInDropPackets or streamInHCDropPackets has exceeded the
streamInDropThreshold value for an interval of one second.
Will contain information pertaining to identity of the dropping
stream.

event.Summary: Stream $v2 drop packets has exceeded the threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInDropFault ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInNum i 9999 ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInName s EXAMPLE

description: An integer value identifying a unique stream on a system. It
is unique for all streams in the system. This value is the same
as that of streamInIndex.
variables.name: ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInNum

description: A unique string identifying a stream on a system. It is unique
for all streams on the system.
variables.name: ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInName

description: A streamInDropNormal notification signifies that the SNMP
entity, acting in an agent role, has detected that the
streamInDropPackets or streamInHCDropPackets value is less than
the streamDropThreshold value for an interval of one second
after it was in streamInDropFault condition. Will contain
information pertaining to the identity of the dropping
stream.

event.Summary: Stream $v2 drop packets is within the threshold

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInDropNormal ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInNum i 9999 ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInName s EXAMPLE

description: An integer value identifying a unique stream on a system. It
is unique for all streams in the system. This value is the same
as that of streamInIndex.
variables.name: ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInNum

description: A unique string identifying a stream on a system. It is unique
for all streams on the system.
variables.name: ENDACE-STREAM-MIB::streamInName
